location map 2.svg")

Twenty of the twenty-one summits are clustered on six ridges. The exception, a
large knoll ranking 13th, is Harrow on the Hill. The lowest two of the six
ridges, with one peak over one hundred metres each, are Shooters Hill on the
relatively small [Blackheath ridge](/wiki/Blackheath,_London "Blackheath,
London"), and Orange Tree Hill in the heart of the old village of [Havering-
atte-Bower](/wiki/Havering-atte-Bower "Havering-atte-Bower"), between
Brentwood and Chigwell, one of several in the [North Weald](/wiki/North_Weald
"North Weald") Ridges and Valleys landscape. On opposite sides of London are
the [North Downs](/wiki/North_Downs "North Downs") and the [Grim's Ditch
(Harrow)](/wiki/Grim%27s_Ditch_\(Harrow\) "Grim's Ditch \(Harrow\)") ridge,
which together have twelve sub-summits.

This is a list of the highest natural points in Greater London, England. These
are the 21 peaks at least 100 metres high. One is an isolated hill, a
[knoll](https://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/knoll "wikt:knoll"), [Harrow on the
Hill](/wiki/Harrow_on_the_Hill "Harrow on the Hill"), the rest are among the
summits of modest hill ridges ([escarpments](/wiki/Escarpment "Escarpment")).

London's highest building, the [Shard London Bridge](/wiki/Shard_London_Bridge
"Shard London Bridge"), stands at 309 metres (1,014 ft) tall a few metres
above sea level. It exceeds the height of any natural rises in London and
adjoining counties, the highest being [Walbury Hill](/wiki/Walbury_Hill
"Walbury Hill").

##
Settlements[[edit](/w/index.php?title=List_of_highest_points_in_London&action=edit&section=2
"Edit section: Settlements")]

Grouped by London Borough, [South Street](/wiki/South_Street,_Bromley "South
Street, Bromley"), a hamlet in [Bromley](/wiki/London_Borough_of_Bromley
"London Borough of Bromley"), is the highest at 220 metres (722 ft) above sea
level. It is at the edge of the [Surrey Hills AONB](/wiki/Surrey_Hills_AONB
"Surrey Hills AONB") which covers the [Surrey](/wiki/Surrey "Surrey") part of
the [North Downs](/wiki/North_Downs "North Downs") and [Greensand
Ridge](/wiki/Greensand_Ridge "Greensand Ridge"). The six next highest are all
near-neighbours: [Horns Green](/wiki/Horns_Green "Horns Green") (216 metres
(709 ft)), [Berry's Green](/wiki/Berry%27s_Green "Berry's Green") and [Biggin
Hill](/wiki/Biggin_Hill "Biggin Hill") (both reaching 190 metres (623 ft)),
[Aperfield](/wiki/Aperfield "Aperfield") and [Single
Street](/wiki/Single_Street "Single Street") (both 180 metres (591 ft)), and
[Luxted](/wiki/Luxted "Luxted") at 177 metres (581 ft).

Outside Bromley the highest settlements are [Sanderstead](/wiki/Sanderstead
"Sanderstead") and [Selsdon](/wiki/Selsdon "Selsdon") (reaching 170 metres
(558 ft) and five metres below that, respectively) in
[Croydon](/wiki/London_Borough_of_Croydon "London Borough of Croydon").

[Arkley](/wiki/Arkley "Arkley") in [Barnet](/wiki/London_Borough_of_Barnet
"London Borough of Barnet") is built up to 147 metres (482 ft). Lower
neighbours are [Monken Hadley](/wiki/Monken_Hadley "Monken Hadley") and
[Chipping Barnet](/wiki/Chipping_Barnet "Chipping Barnet"), both 131 metres
(430 ft), and [Barnet Gate](/wiki/Barnet_Gate "Barnet Gate") 129 metres (423
ft).

The [Vale of Health](/wiki/Vale_of_Health "Vale of Health") is a micro-
locality in [Hampstead Heath](/wiki/Hampstead_Heath "Hampstead Heath") in
[Camden](/wiki/London_Borough_of_Camden "London Borough of Camden") at (130
metres (427 ft). [Harrow on the Hill](/wiki/Harrow_on_the_Hill "Harrow on the
Hill") in [Harrow](/wiki/London_Borough_of_Harrow "London Borough of Harrow")
(124 metres (407 ft)) and [Shooters Hill](/wiki/Shooters_Hill "Shooters Hill")
in [Greenwich](/wiki/Royal_Borough_of_Greenwich "Royal Borough of Greenwich")
(120 metres (394 ft)) also have high positions.

Some have peaks or crests (in the table above) in their definitively built-up
area (e.g. Sanderstead, Harrow on the Hill and Shooters Hill).

[![](//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/d/df/Blackheath.jpg/220px-
Blackheath.jpg)](/wiki/File:Blackheath.jpg)

[](/wiki/File:Blackheath.jpg "Enlarge")

[Blackheath, London](/wiki/Blackheath,_London "Blackheath, London") is a minor
ridge after a short dip reaching a peak at Shooter's Hill in the east; here
the towers of central Lewisham and Croydon beyond to the south-west (right).
The backdrop is the long crest of the [North Downs](/wiki/North_Downs "North
Downs") in the far south of Bromley and adjoining [Surrey](/wiki/Surrey
"Surrey")
